intro: Diplycosia benitotanii, commonly known as the Benito's diplycosia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
